name: 3D scan of a Autoprogettazione Chair by Enzo Mari rendered and exported as a gif
description: Autoprogettazione Chair designed by Enzo Mari, built sometime in 2015 by Tom Burtonwood and Holly Holmes at the Chicago Design Museum at a workshop led by Jessica Charlesworth and Tim Parsons. Scanned by Tom Burtonwood using Infrared 3d scanner and rendered in Blender. The Autoprogettazione chair is part of a series  of open source furniture conceived by the late designer Enzo Mari and intended  to be built easily with simple slats of wood, a hammer and nails. This chair is still in service today in our studio. https://self-assembly.org/library/
